intro: Albuca mater-familias, commonly known as the family plant or mother-of-the-family, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of white or yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with succulent leaves that store water. It produces small, edible bulbs that are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Albuca mater-familias is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in dry conditions.
